title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Hi,

I have an A2141 820-01700 that has 19V on ampmeter, but only 0.06A.

PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 is shorted and CC929 was burnt, and a test pad is gone.

I supose that at least one nand will be burnt. Am I correct? How can I be sure? Can I inject 1V there?

TKS

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Hi,

C8648 was shorted. After replacing it, now I have 2.5V on PP2V5_NAND_SSD1.

Mac takes 19.8V on ampmeter, but 0A (goes to 0.15A but drops to 0A). Should I try DFU restore?

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message: Go for restore, if no data to save.

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
DFU restore failed with an error. Any other idea?

It seams that it is rebooting. Fully assembled, It reatches 0.78A and goes to 0A continuasly. Everythind disconected it stays at 0A.

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Be sure to start from DFU, not Recovery mode.
Use 96/140W charger and connect battery too.

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Hi,

I'm in DFU mode, and I'm using an original 96W charger, and still have the same error.

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Now it stoped being recognized in DFU. It still has 2.5V on PP2V5_NAND_SSD1, but no power on

20V and 0A on ampmeter

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Now it is rebooting. Measuring the power lines, I notice that it reboots (goes to 0V and them up again)

Following the power sequence page, I notice that:

P1V1_SLPDDR_SOCFET_EN has 1.8V (I think it should have 1.1V)

Any idea?

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Pay more atention when you read a schematic.
Enable signal, is not an output voltage.

Did you try to force it in DFU mode?

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message: Yes. I did try it a few times.

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message: Forcing DFU might have damage the NAND (or something else)?

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message: If you didn't put more than 1.8V into SOC_FORCE_DFU (by error), no problem for SSD, or T2.

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Hi. No I haven't done anything like that. Just tried a few times (4 or 5) the DFU restore.

Is there somthing else that i can try?

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message:
Hi,

I've PP3V3_S5 and PP1V8_S5 missing.

PP3V3_S5 = 0V and 0.350 on diode reading
PP1V8_S5 = 0V and 0.334 on diode reading

Can you help?

title: A2141 820-01700 PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 shorted
message: If you can't enter DFU, may have problems with T2.
